name: Marillion Lyrics 1983-87 Online Quiz | Marillion | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which song features the line "Catalogue princess, apprentice seductress,
hiding in her cellophane world in glitter town"?
questions.explanation:
Chelsea Monday.

	'Chelsea Monday' is a track on Marillion's debut album "Script For a Jester's Tear", released in 1983.

questions.text:
"It's six oclock in the tower blocks
The stalagmites of culture shock" is a line from which Marillion song?
questions.explanation:
Heart Of Lothian.

	'Heart Of Lothian" is from the 1985 album "Misplaced Childhood", and was released as a single, reaching number 29 in the UK charts.

questions.text:
Which Marillion track features the lyrics: 
"They boarded up the synagoguesU
zis on a street corner
You can't take a photograph of 
Uzis on a street corner"?
questions.explanation:
White Russian.

	Featured on the 1987 album "Clutching At Straws", a White Russian is a vodka-based cocktail.

questions.text:
"I found smog at the end of my rainbow
I found my thoughts shift slowly into phase" are the opening lines from which Marillion song?
questions.explanation:
Market Square Heroes.

	'Market Square Heroes' was Marillion's debut single, released in 1982, which reached number 53 on the UK charts. The track was not originally included on a Marillion album, but became available on the 1984 compilation album "B'Sides Themselves", and is included on a bonus disc on the 1997 remastered version of "Script for a Jester's Tear".

questions.text:
Which Marillion song features the lyrics: 
"Whatever happened to pillow fights
Whatever happened to jeans so tight
Friday nights"?
questions.explanation:
Punch And Judy.

	'Punch And Judy' is a track from the 1984 album "Fugazi". It was released as a single, reaching number 29 on the UK charts.

questions.text:
"Do you remember, barefoot on the lawn with shooting stars,
Do you remember, loving on the floor in Belsize Park" are lyrics that can be found in which Marillion song?
questions.explanation:
Kayleigh.

	'Kayleigh' was Marillion's biggest hit single of the 20th century, reaching number two on the UK charts. It is a track on the 1985 album "Misplaced Childhood".

questions.text: On which Marillion song can you find the lyrics "Champagne corks are firing at the sun again, swooping swallows chased by violins again"?
questions.explanation:
Garden Party.

	A track on "Script For a Jester's Tear", 'Garden Party'was a 1983 single, reaching number 16 on the UK charts.

questions.text:
"Who decorates the scarf with the fugi knot
Who camouflaged emotion in a thousand yard stare" are lyrics from which Marillion song?
questions.explanation:
Assassing.

	A track on the album "Fugazi", 'Assassing' reached number 22 on the UK singles charts in 1984.

questions.text: Which Marillion song includes the lyrics "Doctor says my liver looks like leaving with my lover, need another 'time out' now"?
questions.explanation:
Torch Song.

	'Torch' is the name of a character on the 1985 concept album "Clutching At Straws", 'Torch Song' describing his descent into alcoholism.

questions.text: Which Marillion track includes the lyrics "Drowning in the liquid seize on the Piccadilly line, Rat race scuttling through the damp electric labyrinth"?
questions.explanation:
Fugazi.

	'Fugazi' is the title track from the 1984 album of the same name. The word Fugazi dates from the Vietnam War, and describes a messed-up situation.
